intro: Trachylomia triglomerata, commonly known as the clustered spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence that bears small, greenish flowers. It typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, preferring moist to waterlogged soils. Trachylomia triglomerata plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
